intro: Koanophyllon rhexioides, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Koanophyllon rhexioides produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
